channel.title: Solving T1, T2 Errors?
channel.description: Normally, when I get a T1 or a T2 error. I google it, and well, of course I get some random irrelevent results due to all the numbers in the search query. How do I go about solving them? Does anyone have a method for it? Or should I just post them and hope for someone to know the issue ;)

item.title: Solving T1, T2 Errors?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:481199”]I’m not exactly sure how to track it, but if I find a way to fix it, I’ll let you know.
I’m not so experienced in that area, but I’m pretty sure blocking some sort of IO would fix it.[/quote]
That’d be extremely helpful. I haven’t seen a performance downfall because of them, but I’d rather not take the chance

Read full topic

item.title: Solving T1, T2 Errors?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’m not exactly sure how to track it, but if I find a way to fix it, I’ll let you know.
I’m not so experienced in that area, but I’m pretty sure blocking some sort of IO would fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Solving T1, T2 Errors?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:481199”]T2’s mean an exception (excluding IOException) was thrown. This often happens if you attempt to show an item not present in the client (so that an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown).

If the exception is an IOException the client is dropped instead of giving the t2.[/quote]
That’s good information to know, but how do I track it?
Oh, what about T1’s?

-Sorry for late reply, it never showed someone replied to the topic.

Read full topic

item.title: Solving T1, T2 Errors?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

T2’s mean an exception (excluding IOException) was thrown. This often happens if you attempt to show an item not present in the client (so that an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown).

If the exception is an IOException the client is dropped instead of giving the t2.

Read full topic
